title: Zero-Trust Security Framework
description: Architected organization-wide zero-trust security implementation with identity-based access controls.
fullDescription: A comprehensive zero-trust architecture implementation covering network segmentation, identity verification, and continuous authorization for all system access.
problem: Traditional perimeter-based security was insufficient for distributed teams and cloud-native infrastructure.
constraints: Must not significantly impact developer productivity. Required support for legacy systems.
approach: Implemented identity-aware proxy, service mesh with mTLS, and just-in-time access provisioning.
tradeoffs: Accepted higher operational complexity for improved security posture. Chose gradual rollout over big-bang migration.
execution: 18-month implementation across 200+ services. Phased approach starting with highest-risk systems.
outcomes: Zero security incidents post-implementation, 90% reduction in standing privileges, passed all external security audits.
whatIdImprove: Would have built better developer documentation and self-service tools earlier.
